pullRequest.body:
Provide instances that say that `Adjunction.CommShift` holds for the identity adjunction and is stable by composition, as well as similar instances for `Equivalence.CommShift`.

- [ ] depends on: #20364

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [8e19ed7b2a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20337/commits/8e19ed7b2a173cf3c57591204a2a721b2655d78d)

|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ commShift_counit_app`
`+ instComp`
`+ instId`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').functor.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').inverse.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).functor.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).inverse.CommShift A := by`
`+ refl_toAdjunction`
`+ unit_app_commShiftIso_hom_app`

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#20364
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This should be directly in the `Adjunction` namespace, which should make unnecessary the `'`.
I can put these lemmas in the `Adjunction` namespace (this is the new commit), but I don't understand the remark about the `'`.

> I can put these lemmas in the `Adjunction` namespace (this is the new commit), but I don't understand the remark about the `'`.

The PR adds `'` to some lemmas, which seems unnecessary to me if the lemmas are put to the `Adjunction` namespace rather than `CommShift`.

I still don't understand. The PR doesn't add `'` to lemmas, just to the fields of the structure `Adjunction.CommShift`, because I wanted to reserve the names without `'` for lemmas as is done, for example, with `NatTrans.CommShift`.
Just do not add `'` when it is not necessary.

I merely copied this model:
```
/-- If `Ï„ : Fâ‚ âŸ¶ Fâ‚‚` is a natural transformation between two functors
which commute with a shift by an additive monoid `A`, this typeclass
asserts a compatibility of `Ï„` with these shifts. -/
class CommShift : Prop where
  comm' (a : A) : (Fâ‚.commShiftIso a).hom â‰« whiskerRight Ï„ _ =
    whiskerLeft _ Ï„ â‰« (Fâ‚‚.commShiftIso a).hom

namespace CommShift

section

variable {A}
variable [NatTrans.CommShift Ï„ A]

lemma comm (a : A) : (Fâ‚.commShiftIso a).hom â‰« whiskerRight Ï„ _ =
    whiskerLeft _ Ï„ â‰« (Fâ‚‚.commShiftIso a).hom := by
  apply comm'
```
from `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Shift.CommShift`, which you apparently wrote yourself.
(But okay, I've removed the primes here...)

The lemma `commShift_unit` is unnecessary as the intended way to use `NatTrans.CommShift` is as follows:
```suggestion
open CommShift in
attribute [instance] commShift_unit commShift_counit

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma unit_app_commShiftIso_hom_app [adj.CommShift A] (a : A) (X : C) :
    adj.unit.app (XâŸ¦aâŸ§) â‰« ((F â‹™ G).commShiftIso a).hom.app X = (adj.unit.app X)âŸ¦aâŸ§' := by
  simpa using (NatTrans.CommShift.comm_app adj.unit a X).symm
```
(Note that the namespaces/names for the API lemmas of `NatTrans.CommShift` are fixed in #20364, so that it would be reasonable to make this PR a PR which depends on it.)

```suggestion
instance instId : (Adjunction.id (C := C)).CommShift A where
  commShift_counit :=
    inferInstanceAs (NatTrans.CommShift (ðŸ­ C).leftUnitor.hom A)
  commShift_unit :=
    inferInstanceAs (NatTrans.CommShift (ðŸ­ C).leftUnitor.inv A)
```

Here, we need to fix the definition of `Adjunction.comp` because it makes "abuse of defeq" which makes it so that Lean cannot identify the (co)unit as a composition of natural transformations which all "structurally" commute to the shifts. The lemma `comp_counit` below should be a lemma (but not simp lemma) attached to the definition `Adjunction.comp`:
```lean
lemma comp_counit : (adj.comp adj').counit =
    (Functor.associator _ _ _ ).inv â‰«
      whiskerRight ((Functor.associator _ _ _ ).hom â‰«
      whiskerLeft _ adj.counit â‰« G'.rightUnitor.hom) _ â‰« adj'.counit := by aesop_cat

/-- Compatibility of `Adjunction.Commshift` with the composition of adjunctions.
-/
instance instComp : (adj.comp adj').CommShift A where
  commShift_counit := by
    rw [comp_counit]
    infer_instance
  commShift_unit := sorry
```

It you add the following attribute to the fixed definition of `comp`, the more correct lemmas `comp_(co)unit` will be generated automatically:
```lean
@[simps! (config := .lemmasOnly) unit counit]
def comp : F â‹™ H âŠ£ I â‹™ G :=
```

```suggestion
  dsimp
```

```suggestion
  dsimp
```

```suggestion
  dsimp [Equivalence.CommShift, refl_toAdjunction]
```

```suggestion
  dsimp
```

```suggestion
  dsimp
```
The definition of `Equivalence.trans` also makes abuse of defeq. **If** you have some motivation for it, you may fix that definition also so that `trans_toAdjunction` becomes `by rfl`.

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Shift/Adjunction, CategoryTheory/Adjunction/Basic): properties of `Adjunction.CommShift`

source.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Triangulated/Adjunction): the right adjoint of a triangulated functor is triangulated
